publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

msIdentifier.idno: Private collection of Dr Treeske Fricke 003

supportDesc.foliation: The manuscript has been foliated in pencil in the centre of the bottom margin.
supportDesc.condition: Traces of intensive use, but in good condition. The cover is slightly abraded and has in one place been damaged by rodents. The cover has become detached in the bottom part of the spine. Especially the lower part of the folios has been darkened by use. There are circular holes in the parchment on .

layout.note: Data on text area and margin dimensions taken from .
Number of characters per line: between 16 (l. 22) and 26 (l. 7).
layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

layout.note: Data on text area and margin dimensions taken from .
Number of characters per line: between 10 and 12.
layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

list.item:
Sentence and section/text dividers:
Four dot asterisk/ Double colon ።
X-shape sign (with dashes above and below) followed by a line (varying in length) to the right after the titles of psalms, after the verses of Psalm 20 (), used irregularly (e.g. ).
X-shape sign (with dashes above and below) after the titles of psalms, used irregularly (e.g. )
Nine dot asterisk ፨ (e.g. )
Colon with dashes above and below (Comma 2 / Enumeration sign 1): ፤, used irregularly (especially from ).
Five to six nine dot asterisks on , and .

Titles and beginnings
Titles and numbers of psalms, very often the second line of the Psalm is also rubricated (with one black line between it and the title), e.g. the beginning of Psalm 63 on or Psalm 103 on , rarely the two first consecutive lines are rubricated, e.g. the beginning of Psalm 148 on .
The first of each unit of ten psalms: Two pairs of rubricated lines, separated by three black lines and followed by two rubricated lines at the bottom of the page: at the of Psalm 1 on , Psalm 21 on , Psalm 71 on , Psalm 131 on and Psalm 141 on . Two pairs of rubricated lines separated by two to three black lines: Psalm 11 on , Psalm 31 on , Psalm 41 on , Psalm 51 on , Psalm 81 on , Psalm 91 on , Psalm 101 (not numbered) on , Psalm 111 on . Three pairs of rubricated lines alternating with four black lines at the beginning of Psalm 121 on . The title and first line: Psalm 61 on .
Two pairs of rubricated lines alternating with two black lines at the beginning of on
The first line or first and third line of each Canticle.
Two pairs of rubricated lines alternating with two black lines at the beginning of on
Chapter numbers and first lines of each chapter in .
The first two lines, followed by two black lines and one rubricated line at the beginning of on
The first two lines of each section of and of .

Names
እግዚአብሔር፡ in and , e.g. on , ,
ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡, ክርስቶስ፡, ማርያም፡ and እግዚአብሔር፡ in and .

Other
Names of the Hebrew letters and their interpretations in Ps. 118 on , with one or two alternating rubricated lines.
The first, third and sixth character of ይባርክዎ፡ in on
The refrain, and the words and abbreviations standing for it in and .
ስ፡ for ስቡሕኒ፡ ውእቱ፡ ወልዑልኒ፡ ውእቱ፡ ለዓለም፡ (Canticle 10, )
ሰአ፡/ሰ፡ ለ፡ ቅ፡ for ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት፡ ()

Words or their abbreviations stand for the whole refrain:
ሠረቀ፡/ሠረ/ሠ፡ for ሠረቀ፡ በሥጋ፡ እምድንግል፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ዘርዓ፡ ብእሲ፡ ወአድኅነነ ()
እስመ፡/እስ፡ for እስመ፡ በፈቃዱ፡ ወበሥምረቱ፡ አቡሁ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ መጽአ፡ ወአድኅነነ፡()
ኵሉ፡ for ኵሉ፡ ትውልድ፡ ያስተበፅዑኪ፡ ለኪ፡ ለባሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ ()
ናዓ፡ for ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ። እስመ፡ ሣህልኪ፡ ይኩን፡ ላዕለ፡ ኵልነ፡()
ለኪ፡ for ለኪ፡ ለባሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ እመ፡ ብርሃን፡ አንቲ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ በስብሐት፡ ወበውዳሴ ፡ ()
ተፈ፡ for ተፈሥሒ፡ ኦምልዕልተ፡ ጸጋ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እስመ፡ ረከብኪ፡ ሞገሰ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ምስሌኪ፡ ()
ወበ፡ for ወበእንተዝ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናንቀዓዱ፡ ኀቤኪ፡ ከመ፡ ንርከብ፡ ሣህለ፡ በኀበ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ፡ ()
ወ፡/ወል፡ ሣ፡ ይ፡ ሰ፡ ለ፡ ቅ፡ for ወልድኪ፡ ሣህሎ፡ ይክፈለነ፡ ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት፡ ()
በእ፡/በእንተ፡ for ወበእንተዝ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናንቀዓዱ፡ ኀቤኪ፡ ከመ፡ ንርከብ፡ ሣህለ፡ በኀበ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ፡ ()

decoNote.desc: An miniature of , identified by the caption ቅ፡ ጊዮርጊስ, slaying the dragon with a spear.
The , surrounded by two angels at the top.
A of , identified by the caption አቡነ፡ ገብረ፡ መንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡. A lion, identified by the caption አንበሳ, is standing to his right and a leopard, identified by the caption ነብር, to his left.
A showing standing in the middle, surrounded by a man holding a vessel to the left and to the right. The are identified by the caption ን፡ ሳባና፡ ን፡ ሶሰሞን፡.
A showing , identified by the caption ንጉሥ፡ ዳዊት፡ playing on the harp, በገና፡
A of , identified by the caption አ፡ ተክለሃይማኖት.
The showing , identified by the caption ቅ፡ ገብርኤል፡, standing to the left and , identified by the caption ፫ ደቂቅ, sitting in the furnace. In the background, there is a church building.
Black and white ornamental band with interlaces, lateral extensions.
Black and white ornamental band with interlaces, lateral extensions.
Pen-work divider consisting of black dots.
Pen-work divider consisting of black dots.
Pen-work divider consisting of black dots.
Pen-work divider consisting of black and red dots.
Pen-work divider consisting of black dots.
Pen-work divider consisting of black dots.
Pen-work divider consisting of black and red dots.
Pen-work divider consisting of black and red dots.

item.desc: Remains of an erased note in the top margin.
Written in pencil in the top margin.
Pencil scribbles added within the text.
Omitted text has been added in the margin and interlineally, possibly in a secondary hand in many cases, for example the folios listed here.
Line take-ups in many cases, for example the folios listed here.
Errors and dittographies have been marked by dashes above and below the word.
Errors and dittographies have been encircled.
Errors have been erased and the correction written above in many cases, for example the folios listed here.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather.
The manuscript is kept in a single-slip case with leather strap (māḥdar).
inserted in the the upper corner of , , , , , , , , , , .

history.provenance: The manuscript was acquired by the mother of Dr Treeske Fricke during her stay in in 1963-1975.
